review_title: New grads, please avoid this place
job_title: Registered Nurse in Fountain Valley, CA
pros: To be honest, none that I can see/say. To our specific unit, our team is very helpful, enjoyable, and cooperative ONLY because the entire place always doesn't have resources. No CNA, no secretary, even sometimes no monitor tech, and no charge nurse.
cons:
1. No resource at all - no CNA, no unit secretary, no resource nurse, no charge nurse at times
2. Hospital AND union, I don't know why they exist. They do nothing to improve the work environment, they don't hire people & don't care about nurses or CNAs because they don't have money? Hey, if you are hiring a bunch of travelers, why don't you guys give us enough raise?
3. Lowest pay among the orange county, including St. Joseph. Raise? few cents per year.
4. New grads... please apply to other places. This is not the place you can safely work at all, this hospital won't support you. You will learn A LOT just because there are no resources and YOU have to do every single thing. The weirdest place ever!
5. Oh and the health insurance, they cover nothing, one of the worst insurance coverage I have ever seen.
5. Vietnamese community hospital. A certain unit they have their own culture, and if we go there to help them out, they will give no help, no resources, and ignore you.

pros: Wonderful patients, one of the few standalone pediatric units in an otherwise adult hospital.

review_title: I was a loyal hard-working employee that was treated very unjustly and let go.
job_title: in Fountain Valley, Orange, CA
pros: The people I worked with are great!! Great benefits and flexable work schedules.  I love my co-workers!!! Great group of people!!
cons: Accusations to employees with no proof it was actually that employee in question.   Employees used as scape-goats for problems that were all around due to new changes being made by management--and the new changes weren't working!

job_title: Respiratory Therapist in Fountain Valley, CA
pros: Dynamic environment with various patients from neonates to geriatrics.
cons: Management preaches attention to patient care, but overwhelms with workloads with no regard to time or location. Punitive & chastised for insignificant errors, such as not removing equipment from a room. Dichotomy & dissension between management & workers.

review_title: Sometimes it just felt like family.
job_title: Phlebotomist in Fountain Valley, CA
pros: You meet the most amazing people culturally, intellectually and at times you feel like you are a part of the TEAM.
cons: The only challenging part of this job is the language barrier. I encourage anyone to take advantage of the English speaking family members to gather basic words of communication for your field and practice, practice, practice !!! Trust me it makes the job easier when people understand why you're there and  why you need to touch them.

review_title: I couldn't distance myself from FV Hospital fast enough
job_title: CNA in Fountain Valley, CA
pros: High emphasis on HIGH QUALITY of care ....when in fact the emphasis is HOW THE HOSPITAL CAN MAKE MORE MONEY and overwork nursing staff to the breaking point....not quite a PRO
cons:
Nothing in their policy and procedures is clear....everything is GRAY, double standards depending on who you are as a person; employee actions are interpreted at their discretion and deemed WRONG if their actions are towards the best interest of the patient and not necessarily the hospital!!!!
Patients are treated poorly! NO QUALITY in patient care whatsoever.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fountain Valley, CA
pros: Managers and directors were very nice and professional
cons: Union dues required. Per diem staff RN’s are paid less than full time or part time. Orientation is time consuming and unorganized.

job_title: Admitting Representative in Fountain Valley, CA
pros: If you're looking for random shifts part time this is the place.  You'll be shifted all over the place with no set schedule.
cons: Don't expect a full time position unless they fire someone.  Politics are rampant here.  Very negative environment.

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Fountain Valley, CA
pros: The only reason to work here would be the friends you may have had while working here.
cons: I can't speak for other depts but Patient Access employees are treated like dirt by management. Unless you're buddies with management team your work schedule may change on a weekly basis. They have no trust in their employees and will implement ridiculous protocols that would require a lot of time to complete, but yet expect you to be done in a very short time. Management will roam around like sharks micromanaging and pick on employees. I truly feel that the reason they don't hire quality workers is because they are afraid for their own jobs.

job_title: ER Registered Nurse in Fountain Valley, CA
pros: The staff at FVR are amazing
cons: The union won't advocate for you and even if they do nothing ever comes of it. For example, our nurses have not gotten a raise in almost a year even though every other year we have and it says we are supposed to in our contracts. Also constantly running out of things we need and important equipment will break down because the hospital and management does not want to pay the money to keep things nice.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fountain Valley, CA
pros: I started here as a new grad and I did learn a lot at this place. There are nurses who eat their young and there are nurses who are great teachers. I was very fortunate to work with nurses who taught me a lot.
cons: I don’t even know where to start. ALWAYS ALWAYS ALWAYS short staffed! Do you want to take 3 ICU patients or 5 DOU patients? Btw DOU is hell even when the ratio was 1:3, during the pre-Covid time. Nobody wants to work in/float to DOU, especially night shift. The management is a joke. The company is so cheap that they found someone who has ZERO, I mean Z-E-R-O experience with critical care to dictate how to run ICU/DOU. God bless those patients.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Fountain Valley, CA
pros: The people. You have some dedicated staff in each department. Many of them are team players and will help others, while some just do the job and leave. We don't follow the same pt and increased communication between CMs may help discharge and keep a pt out of the hospital longer.
cons: It should be a requirement that the pt be able to understand the nurse. When I was a pt, I had to ask foreign nurses to speak slower, directly to me and about specifics. Don't get me wrong but older patients have more problems with hearing and if they passively say yes and don't understand, whose fault is it if a patient comes back.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fountain Valley, CA
pros: Awesome co-workers and team work, the ONLY reason I am still there.
cons: Almost always short staffed and difficult patient population. It is impossible to provide good patient care but we are constantly chastised for not doing so. Several days I have been scared for my patients because I am unable to provide the care they need.  Nurses are burning out FAST.  They expect 200% from us but are unwilling to give us the compensation we deserve.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fountain Valley, CA
pros: Facility willing to train New Grads. Offers a decent medical, dental, life insurance package. Facility is represented by the union.
cons: The facility is frequently short-staffed.   There are many times when you don't have beds/ rooms for the patients or the supplies you need.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Fountain Valley, CA
pros: I’ve worked in the Emergency Department for 5 years and I love my work family! Everyone works so well together here. We get super busy and patients are acutely ill so nursing competencies are too notch! Management promotes evidence based practice and opportunities for growth. Administration also very supportive and visible. The CEO and CNO seems to know everyone’s name.
cons: Union gets in the way

job_title: Ex HIM in Fountain Valley, CA
pros: I loved Fountain Valley when I first got there. Then as a turnover of CEOs became more frequent, management went from very supportative to almost bullying in behavior.  I heard the phrase, "If you don't like it, there's the door.".
cons: Actual bullying by new management.  I became so sick I got a lawyer.  Frequent meetings, emails, etc.  They got away with it. Ganging up on the weak employees and having them dismissed.

job_title: Technician in Fountain Valley, CA
pros: Great co-workers so you do enjoy them.
cons: PROFIT HOSPITAL equals no money going back into hospital to update  the place.  Favoritism can be overwhelming and no support for this.

review_title: Management does not respect their employees
job_title: Professional in Fountain Valley, CA
